roleset.name: to make or become full

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Outside, a young pressman filling a news box with an extra edition headlined ``Herald Examiner Closes'' refused to take a reader's quarter.
example.arg: with an extra edition headlined ``Herald Examiner Closes''

example.name: with Arg1 and Arg2
example.text: In this one, the screen fills with photographs of both candidates.

example.name: passive
example.text: The dispute has hampered the administration's efforts to recruit prominent doctors [0]-1 [*T*-1] to fill prestigious posts at the helm of the NIH and the Centers for Disease Control.
example.arg: prestigious posts at the helm of the NIH and the Centers for Disease Control
example.note: The 'doctors' are not agentively filling the post (ie, causing the container to be filled with some substance), but rather the doctors ARE the substance in the container. Compare with the next example.

example.name: with Arg0 and Arg1
example.text: Hungary's Parliament voted to hold a national referendum on an election [*] to fill the new post of president.
example.note: Here the Parliament is filling the post with someone else. Compare to the example above.

roleset.note: Member of VNcls fill-9.8, cother_cos-45.4, ontiguous_location-47.8.

example.name: damn stock reportage anyway
example.text: [The order]-1 was filled *trace*-1 at $75 when the stock opened at that price on Monday.
example.arg: when the stock opened at that price on Monday

example.name: all args
example.text: As part of the crew for The Beach, Hilary filled the requirement as Safety Diver and at times swimming alongside the Palm Tree laden barge from open water to shore, ensuring a safe clearance from the coral heads in the bay.
example.arg: As part of the crew for The Beach
as Safety Diver and at times swimming alongside the Palm Tree laden barge from open water to shore, ensuring a safe clearance from the coral heads in the bay.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'fill' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

roleset.name: fill up: to make or become full

example.name: with Arg0 and Arg1
example.text: It also empowers the president to make recess appointments, without Senate approval: ``[The President]-1 shall have Power [*]-1 to fill up all Vacancies that may happen during the Recess of the Senate, by granting Commissions which shall expire at the End of their next Session.''
example.arg: all Vacancies that may happen during the Recess of the Senate
by granting Commissions which shall expire at the End of their next Session

roleset.note: See VNcls fill-9.8, cother_cos-45.4, ontiguous_location-47.8, but verb particle constructions are not included in VN.

roleset.name: fill out: to complete, fill in

role.descr: agent, poor schmuck with a pen

example.name: gerund
example.text: [*] Filling out detailed forms about these individuals would tip the IRS off and spark action against the clients, he said.

example.name: collect a full set
example.text: NCNB-1 raised some $1.9 billion in new capital during the quarter [*-1]-2 to complete the NCNB Texas purchase , and to acquire several small failed thrifts [*-2] to fill out its regional franchise.

roleset.name: fill in: to complete, fill in

role.descr: agent, poor schmuck with a pen

example.name: gerund
example.text: [*] Filling in detailed forms about these individuals would tip the IRS off and spark action against the clients, he said.

role.descr: person, thing acting as something else

example.name: substitute
example.text: ...I 'm Paula Zahn filling in for the two men Anderson Cooper and Aaron Brown.
example.arg: for the two men Anderson Cooper and Aaron Brown.

frameset.note: frames created by Olga, modified by Paul to add additional phrasal variants and improve readability. Frames edited by Arrick
